attributes.action: Place restrictions on the press during times of national crisis
attributes.additional_details: Press releases during the corona virus have caused surges in panic buying and hoarding amongst the British public. Certain newspapers release scaremongering headlines in an effort to increase sales. In times of crisis the government should be able to stop press releases that can cause panic in the public domain.
attributes.background: Carefully monitor and scrutinise headlines and press releases during times of crisis such as the corona virus

rejection.details:
We have published a petition calling on the Government to criminalise the publication of unfounded false statements by the media, which you might like to sign: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/303050

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

NHS website: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

UK Government website: https://www.gov.uk/coronavirus
